heaviest_rainfall.status: The most intense rainfall recorded took place on 04 January 2025, with precipitation totalling 36.8mm.  The rain fell at 4.6mm per hour at times over the course of the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The rain rate reached 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, and resulted in 21.19mm of rain over 15.0 hours.  This is the highest rate recorded by our weather station.

longest_rain.status: The record duration for continuous rain was set on 04 January 2025, the storm lasted 37.2 hours with a total precipitation of 36.8mm and it reached 4.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: Since 11 April 2025, the day with the most lightning strikes is 07 September 2025 when 23 were seen.

nearest_lightning.status: The closest strike happened on 13 May 2025, a distance of just 4.97 miles away.

storm.status: Currently no stormy weather.  The most recent storm happened on 14 September 2025 and it lasted for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not an active cold snap.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 3.7.

extreme.status: The largest temperature difference recorded was 26.7°C on 29 April 2025.  On that date the temperature reached 27.1°C and fell to 0.4°C.

heatwaves.status: At the moment, it is not a heatwaves.  This year has seen 6 heatwavess; typically, 1.9 heatwavess happen every year.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was recorded on 18 July 2025.  The total number of occurrences since 1973 number is only 62.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (196°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: To date, the maximum wind gust recorded is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The top recorded wind run is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The record wind speed remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, a bit warmer for the outside temperature (up 2.8°C), feels like temperature (up 2.4°C), and inside temperature (up 1.6°C) and drier conditions in outside humidity (down 6%) and rainfall (down 0.8 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in light levels (up 8291 lux), cloud levels (up 751 m), feels like temperature (up 3.8°C), and outside temperature (up 2.1°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 445.7m higher than yesterday, 172.9m lower than the past week, 751.1m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, the cloud levels ranged from a minimum of 557m to a maximum of 1248m, averaging 1391.4m; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 1564.3m and 2140m respectively.
cloud levels.summary: A high cloud base will mean mostly sunny conditions.

summary.summary: Inside; temperatures should be quite comfortable. Outside; mild temperatures are expected. Also, air will feel comfortable and balanced and calm and still conditions are expected. A few light raindrops may fall, a high cloud base will mean mostly sunny conditions, and some sunny spells will occur. Low pressure may bring unsettled weather.
